column3: I'd say some of the errors are exceptions that rarely happen and shouldn't be translated
@MarcoFalke added rationale, removed [WIP]

> I'd say some of the errors are exceptions that rarely happen and shouldn't be translated\n\nI agree. There's also the problem, especially with extremely rare error messages (such as the secp256k1 failure) that translating them makes them impossible to google. This doesn't really weigh up to the advantage of translating the message if it's very technical in the first place, so translating won't
I'd say yes.\n(coincidentally, too late for this for 0.18, translation string freeze was February 1)

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16127](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16127.html) (Add support for thread safety annotations w
Ref: [IRC discussion](http://www.erisian.com.au/bitcoin-core-dev/log-2019-02-02.html#l-265)

> I'd say some of the errors are exceptions that rarely happen and shouldn't be translated

Removed translations of error messages inside `InitSanityCheck()`.
PR description updated.

[Translation Strings Policy](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/translation_strings_policy.md#gui-strings):\n> Anything that appears to the user in the GUI is to be translated. This includes labels, menu items, button texts, tooltips and window titles. This includes messages passed to the GUI through the UI interface through **`InitMessage`**, `ThreadSafeMessageBox` or `ShowProgre
Ref: [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6870#discussion_r42965071) by @laanwj:\n\n> I think errors relating directly to user options should be kept translated.
Rebased.
Rebased.

@MarcoFalke
> Tend to NACK. This will put the translated message into the debug log

> I guess the translation should be registered here only and then later translated in InitError with `_()`

Agree. There was a dedicated PR #15340.

So, closing this PR now.
